title: Qatar royals mull IPO for Italian fashion house Valentino
text:
By Staff writer Wednesday, 14 October 2015 3:09 PM 
Mayhoola For Investments SPC, the investment firm run by the Qatari royal family, is considering a listing for the Valentino Fashion Group, the luxury Italian fashion brand it bought for â‚¬700 million ($798 million) in 2012, it was reported this week. 
Sources told the Bloomberg news agency the Qatari owners were working with Rothschild on the potential IPO and the brand, which was founded by designer Valentino Garavani in Rome in 1960, has been valued at around 2 billion euros. 
Mayhoola will reportedly list between 25 and 35 percent of the company as early as the first half of 2016. 
Representatives for Mayhoola and Rothschild declined to comment when contacted by Bloomberg.
